message_1: Consider a knot that is made by tying an ordinary shoelace into a closed loop. Let the knot be placed in 3-dimensional Euclidean space. What is the minimum number of times that the shoelace must cross itself in order to produce a nontrivial (i.e. non-unknot) knot?
message_2: The minimum number of times that the shoelace must cross itself in order to produce a nontrivial knot is 3. This is known as the trefoil knot, which is the simplest nontrivial knot.
